candidate_text: The burrito chain is dealing with an E. coli outbreak that has sickened dozens of people in several states, as well as a norovirus outbreak at one location in California.
The burrito chain is facing its third food safety crisis in six months, and investors are getting anxious.

Dr. Eric Coleman is the Director of the Care Transitions Program at the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus and the author of "The Care Transitions Intervention."
He is a professor of medicine at the University of Colorado School of Medicine and a geriatrician at the Denver VA Medical Center.
He is a nationally recognized expert in care transitions and has worked with numerous healthcare organizations to improve their transitional care processes.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving health outcomes for patients with complex needs, particularly those with chronic conditions and those who are transitioning between healthcare settings.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving communication between healthcare providers, patients, and caregivers during times of transition (e.g., hospital discharge, emergency department visit).
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving communication and coordination between healthcare providers during patient handoffs, reducing readmissions, and enhancing patient safety.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality and safety of patient transitions between different healthcare settings, such as from hospital to home or from one provider to another.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality of care transitions by empowering patients and their caregivers to take an active role in their care.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving patient outcomes by ensuring that patients receive high-quality, coordinated care as they transition between different healthcare settings.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving communication and collaboration between healthcare providers, patients, and caregivers during care transitions.

Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality and safety of patient care as they transition between different healthcare settings, such as from hospital to home or from skilled nursing facility to community-based care.

Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality and safety of patient care as they move across different healthcare settings, such as from hospital to home or from one provider to another.

Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving health outcomes for patients with complex needs, particularly during times of transition, such as when they are discharged from the hospital or move between different healthcare settings.
Dr. Coleman received his medical degree from the University of California, San Francisco, and completed his residency in internal medicine at the University of Chicago.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality of care transitions through the development of evidence-based interventions and tools.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality of care transitions by empowering patients and families through education, support, and guidance during times of transition.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality of patient care as they transition between different healthcare settings, such as from hospital to home or from skilled nursing facility to home.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality of care transitions by addressing the needs of patients as they move across different healthcare settings.
Dr. Coleman's work focuses on improving the quality of care transitions by identifying and addressing the root causes of hospital readmissions.
